output_list.criticism: The totalSupply function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the total supply to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The transfer function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The transferFrom function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The approve function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the allowance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The allowance function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the allowance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The balances function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setBalance function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setBalances function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setTotalSupply function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the total supply to any value, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
The setOwner function is vulnerable to integer overflow. An attacker can set the owner to any address, potentially leading to a loss of funds for the contract owner.
